text: Anneliese Brandler (4 March 1904 – 1970) was a German chess player who won the West Germany Women's Chess Championship in 1962. ==Biography== In the 1950s and in the 1960s, Anneliese Brandler was one of the leading chess players in the West Germany. She won six medals in West Germany Women's Chess Championships: gold (1962), three silver (1957, 1958, 1963) and two bronzes (1959, 1961).11\. Deutsche Damenmeisterschaft 1957 vom 28. Oktober bis 7. November 1957 in Lindau16\. Deutsche Damenmeisterschaft 1962 vom 3. bis 14. September 1962 in Eckernförde Brandler played for West Germany in the Women's Chess Olympiad: * In 1963, at second board in the 2nd Chess Olympiad (women) in Split (+3, =2, -6). ==References== ==External links== * Category:1904 births Category:1970 deaths Category:German female chess players Category:Chess Olympiad competitors Category:20th-century chess players
title: Anneliese Brandler
